oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Entwicklung und Betrieb eines mobilen Freilandhaltungssystems zur ökologischen Kaninchenmast
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Berger, Helfried
Rentschler, Tobias
Tschich, Johannes
Siegmeier, Torsten
Möller, Detlev
Richter, Uwe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Animal husbandry
Feeding and growth
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rabbit fattening in mobile cages on pasture is one of the most effective ways to convert cheap and abundant grass into a healthy, sustainably produced meat product of high nutritious value without competing for human food resources. Efforts to develop a functional and dependable system failed in various occasions over the last years. Barricades preventing rabbits from escaping through digging as well as barricades against predators are the link to combine mobility and reliability to operate an outdoor husbandry system properly. This project developed a mobile cage for 50-100 rabbits with an effective technical barricade without compromising mobility.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Berger, Helfried; Rentschler, Tobias; Tschich, Johannes; Siegmeier, Torsten; Möller, Detlev and Richter, Uwe (2014) Entwicklung und Betrieb eines mobilen Freilandhaltungssystems zur ökologischen Kaninchenmast. [Development of a mobile free-range husbandry system for rabbit fattening in organic farming.] Poster at: 13. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Hochschule für nachhaltige Entwicklung Eberswalde, 17. - 20. März 2015.
